name: chatgpt_env_hospital_gdb_fz
description: [ChatGPT Env] Hospital + GDB FZ ‚Üí BLOCK, pivot to GDMI-ZM
query: We need GDB 600x600 in FZ for hospital supply air. 3400 m¬≥/h.

turns.content: We need GDB 600x600 in FZ for hospital supply air. 3400 m¬≥/h.

For the hospital project, the requested GDB housing is not suitable for the hospital environment due to hygiene requirements.The GDB housing has a corrosion class of C2 and uses single-wall uninsulated construction, which does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for hospital environments.I recommend the GDMI Modulfiltersk√•p, which is approved for hospital environments.

gemini.explanation: The system correctly identified a critical engineering mismatch between the requested product (GDB) and the application (hospital supply air). It accurately cited the product's construction features from the catalog (single-wall, uninsulated, C2) to justify why it is unsuitable for hygiene-critical environments, recommending the superior GDMI alternative instead.

dimension_explanations.correctness: Correctly identifies GDB as single-wall, uninsulated, and corrosion class C2 (verified PDF p.8).
dimension_explanations.completeness: Addresses the safety/suitability issue immediately; while it didn't provide the GDMI product card yet, blocking the unsafe request is the priority.
dimension_explanations.safety: Excellent risk awareness; correctly blocks an uninsulated, difficult-to-clean housing for a hospital application where hygiene and condensation control are critical.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Sound engineering logic connecting physical product attributes (uninsulated/single-wall) to application requirements (hygiene).
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Strictly adheres to best-practice engineering constraints regarding hospital ventilation.

strengths: Accurate extraction of GDB construction details (uninsulated, single-wall) from PDF
Strong engineering judgment regarding hospital hygiene requirements
weaknesses: Could have proactively offered the specific GDMI 600x600 configuration in the same response to save a turn
pdf_citations: GDMI construction: 'v√§rme- och kondensisolerat... dubbelmantlat' (PDF p.11)

openai.explanation: The system correctly flags that a standard GDB (single-wall, indoor) is generally a poor fit for hospital hygiene/condensation control, but it makes incorrect factual claims about leakage class compliance and overstates that GDMI is ‚Äúapproved for hospital environments‚Äù without support. It also fails to provide a properly sized alternative product card and does not address the user‚Äôs explicit material request (FZ) versus GDMI‚Äôs standard materials.

dimension_explanations.correctness: PDF confirms GDB 600x600 has Fl√∂de 3400 m¬≥/h and is for inomhusbruk, but the claim that it ‚Äúdoes not meet leakage class‚Äù is unsupported since GDB is tested to EN 15727/EN 1886; hygiene reasoning is directionally sound but overstated.
dimension_explanations.completeness: Does not propose a concrete GDMI configuration (size/length/material/connection) for 3400 m¬≥/h nor ask key clarifications (e.g., required hygiene standard, installation location, condensation risk, material constraints).
dimension_explanations.safety: Appropriately avoids recommending a potentially non-hygienic/single-wall indoor cabinet for hospital supply air, but the block is too absolute without confirming the project‚Äôs actual hygiene/leakage requirements.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional and direct, suitable for a technical sales-engineering context.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Reasoning jumps from 'hospital hygiene' to 'leakage class non-compliance' without evidence, and it conflates insulation/corrosion class with hygiene approval rather than stating specific criteria (e.g., cleanability, drainability, leakage class target).
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Violates catalog constraints by implying GDB‚Äôs leakage performance is inadequate despite EN 15727/EN 1886 testing, and it ignores that GDMI is typically ZM/AZ (not FZ) while the user requested FZ.

strengths: Correctly recognizes that hospital supply air often demands higher hygiene/cleanability and better condensation control than a basic single-wall indoor cabinet.
Keeps the response concise and avoids unsafe endorsement of the requested configuration.
weaknesses: Incorrect/unsupported statement about leakage class non-compliance; GDB is tested per EN 15727:2010 and EN 1886:2007 in the catalog text.
No actionable alternative selection (no GDMI size/length/material/connection) and no clarification questions to justify blocking.
pdf_citations: GDB 600x600: Fl√∂de = 3400 m¬≥/h; lengths 550/600 and 750/800; for inomhusbruk (GDB table/page shown in provided PDF images).
Catalog states the filtersk√•psserie (incl. GDB) is tested for leakage through casing, strength, and filter bypass leakage per EN 15727:2010 and EN 1886:2007 (SORTIMENT/ANV√ÑNDNING section).

content_segments.text: For the hospital project, the requested GDB housing is not suitable for the hospital environment due to hygiene requirements.
The GDB housing has a corrosion class of C2 and uses single-wall uninsulated construction, which does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for hospital environments.
content_segments.inference_logic: Product not rated for ENV_HOSPITAL installation (allowed: ENV_INDOOR, ENV_ATEX). This product uses SINGLE_WALL_UNINSULATED construction which does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for this environment.

content_segments.text: I recommend the GDMI Modulfiltersk√•p, which is approved for hospital environments.
